meanings.sent1: The quaverers gathered in the park to practice their singing.
meanings.sent2: The choir was full of talented quaverers who could hit high notes effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The quaverers tried to harmonize but ended up sounding like a flock of confused birds.
meanings.sent4: The group of quaverers resembled a symphony of delicate butterflies fluttering in unison.
meanings.sent5: The quaverers' voices filled the room with a gentle, trembling melody.

meanings.definition: quaverers: those who quaver in fear or uncertainty
meanings.sent1: The quaverers huddled together, afraid of the approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: The haunted house was filled with quaverers, their shaky voices echoing through the halls.
meanings.sent3: The quaverers' fear of spiders was so intense that they screamed at the sight of a tiny one.
meanings.sent4: The quaverers' uncertainty about the future made them hesitant to make any decisions.
meanings.sent5: The quaverers' trembling hands betrayed their inner turmoil.
